snippet: Sprinklers, perhaps more ubiquitous in New York than in any other city, are often gussied up in fanciful designs: a sea turtle, a ship, even a subway token.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; many New Yorkers have fond memories of playing in the city's water sprinklers, perhaps more ubiquitous in New York than in any other city; they are often gussied up in fanciful designs: sea turtle, a ship, even a subway token; city's parks have more than 750 sprinklers, which are part of city's physical and psychic fabric.
lead_paragraph: Sprinklers, perhaps more ubiquitous in New York than in any other city, are often gussied up in fanciful designs: a sea turtle, a ship, even a subway token.

headline.main: City’s Love Affair With the Summer Sprinkler Bursts Forth
headline.print_headline: City’s Love Affair With the Summer Sprinkler Bursts Forth
